title: Kosher Salt Encrusted Prime Rib Roast

instructions.1: Preheat oven to 210 degrees F (100 degrees C).
instructions.2: Cover the bottom of a roasting pan with a layer of kosher salt. Place the roast, bone side down, on the salt. Season the meat with the ground black pepper and seasoning salt, then cover completely with kosher salt.
instructions.3: Roast in preheated oven for 4 to 5 hours, or until the internal temperature of the meat reaches 145 degrees F (63 degrees C).
instructions.4: Remove from oven and let rest for 30 minutes. This sets the juices and makes the roast easier to carve. (Note: Be sure to remove all the salt from the roast before serving.)

questions.question: In Step 3, is the meat from Step 2 being used?
Is meat from Step 2 used in multiple future steps without being redefined?
Is seasoning salt from Step 2 still available in Step 3?
Is seasoning salt live after Step 2?
What is the last time interval specified in Step 4?
If we skip Step 2, is it still valid to use the meat in Step 3?
Can we preheat (Step 1) and roast (Step 3) at the same time?
